The transcriptional mechanisms that drive colony - forming unit granulocyte-macrophage ( CFU-GM ) myeloid progenitors to differentiate into cells of either the granulocytic or monocytic lineage are not fully understood .

We have shown that the <extra_id_0> c-Maf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factors physically interact in myeloid cells to form inhibitory complexes that hinder transactivation of <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> target genes through direct binding to Myb consensus sites .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Binding physically interact <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme c-Maf <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme c-Myb <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: These complexes arise in a developmentally regulated pattern , peaking at the promyelocyte stage , or in cell model systems , appearing soon after the induction of monocytic differentiation .
We wished to determine if this developmentally related interaction is a consequence of myeloid differentiation or an intrinsic differentiating stimulus .

Because the elevated Myb : Maf status seen in differentiating cells can be recapitulated by overexpression of <extra_id_0> c-Maf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in myeloid cell lines , we inducibly expressed the <extra_id_0> c-Maf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA in 2 bipotent human myeloid progenitor cells .

text: Elevated levels of <extra_id_0> c-Maf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein led to marked increases in Myb : Maf complexes and the accumulation of monocyte / macrophage cells , followed by eventual programmed cell death .

Analysis of targets that could mediate these phenotypic changes indicated that <extra_id_0> c-Maf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> likely plays a key role in myeloid cell development through dual mechanisms ; inhibition of a select set of <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulated targets , such as <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD13 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> APN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , coupled with the activation of as yet undefined differentiation - promoting genes .
